definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: The hijacker was sentenced to 3 years.
sentences.chinese: 最後，這名劫匪被判刑3年。

sentences.english: To which the mugger responded, "Duh, do you think I grabbed you for your looks?"
sentences.chinese: 劫匪回答“咋，你還以爲我是要劫色嗎？”

sentences.english: In some cases, the robbers try to sell the work on the open market.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情況下，劫匪試圖在公開市場出售。

sentences.english: As the robber was rewriting the note the teller activated a silent alarm.
sentences.chinese: 就在劫匪拿回去重寫時，櫃員拉響了無聲警報器。

sentences.english: Police yelled at the robbers, ordering them to put down their guns.
sentences.chinese: 警察叱令劫匪放下手中的槍。

sentences.english: She clenched her purse when the mugger tried to take it from her.
sentences.chinese: 劫匪想搶她的包，她就緊緊地握着它。

sentences.english: The robber concealed the weapon under his coat.
One of the robbers fired two shots at the ceiling to warn the store's security guards.
sentences.chinese: 期間一名劫匪朝天花板連開兩槍以震懾商場保安。

sentences.english: Oddly, the robbers do not seem interested in the bank's money.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是，劫匪對銀行裏面的錢並無興趣。

sentences.english: Joe and Eddie are bank robbers.
sentences.chinese: 他們是喬和埃迪，兩個銀行劫匪。

sentences.english: The robbers were armed to the teeth when they robbed the bank.
sentences.chinese: 劫匪們搶銀行的時候是全副武裝的。

sentences.english: The robber stripped him of money.
sentences.chinese: 攔路劫匪把他的錢搶走了。

sentences.english: Analyses the train robbery and bandit get-away.
sentences.chinese: 分析了火車劫匪的逃脫。

sentences.english: The robber took the $40 and left.
sentences.chinese: 於是劫匪就帶着這40美元離開了。

sentences.english: Several days later, some newspaper carried a story of his heroic deed on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 幾天後，有報紙刊出了他勇鬥劫匪的報道。

sentences.english: Man mistakes building for bank in holdup vienna austria-a man mistook a muni.
sentences.chinese: 奧地利劫匪錯將政府辦公大樓當銀行。
